frameDefinitions: In this frame an Agent continues to possess a Theme for a Duration of time. ''
An Agent begins preventing a Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the Captive to do so.
A Cognizer applies oneself to commit a Pattern to memory, so that the Cognizer would recognize future examples of the Pattern or be able to reproduce it.
In this frame a Container holds within its physical boundaries the Contents.

These words describe how outgoing or sociable a Protagonist is judged to be by a (usually implicit) Judge, often in a particular context, either with certain people (the Company), or about a particular situation, topic or event (the Content).
The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges).
frameExamples: In her heart she must <t>retain</t> bitterness against those who had killed him.
Authorities recently <t>captured</t> several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
A gaggle of students were frantically <t>memorizing</t> the answers out in the hall.
He was <t>shy</t> with strangers and afraid of showing his feelings.
The police <t>held</t> Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The entity which the <fen>Agent</fen> possesses for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The entity which is captured.
The <fen>Agent</fen> brings the <fen>Captive</fen> into custody.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Captive</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The sentient being that focuses on a <fen>Pattern</fen> so that it will remain in the memory.
The phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> observes and commits to memory.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> memorizes the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
The location wherein the <fen>Cognizer</fen> memorizes the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
The <fen>Container</fen> is the physical object which holds within its boundaries the <fen>Contents</fen>
The <fen>Contents</fen> is the substance or objects contained within the physical bounds of the <fen>Container</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Container</fen> holds the <fen>Contents</fen>.
The Protagonist is the person whose sociability is being described.
The Protagonist may be sociable, shy, outgoing, etc. when with particular Company (specific people or types of people).  Company usually occurs in a PP Complement with a target adjective:
The Protagonist may be sociable, shy, outgoing, etc. when in a particular situation, or about performing some action.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> hold the <fen>Suspect</fen> in custody.
This role identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
When the detaining occurs.
Where the detaining takes place.
listRoleExamples: At all times <fex>the Saxon government</fex> held on to its insistently practiced political tradition.
Once you've got a War Bond, hang on to <fex>it</fex> for the full ten years of its life.
Margerite held on to the key <fex>on Wednesday</fex> until I returned to pick it up.
He will retain <fex>in his heart</fex> the memory of the vast Holocaust.
Police have captured <fex>three of the suspected bombers</fex> after a week-long search.
<fex>Authorities</fex> recently captured several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
Authorities secured the target <fex>in a private residence</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> have memorized two kinds of knowledge from Allah's Apostle
Impress your friends by memorizing <fex>your phone numbers</fex> and throwing away your PDA!
Herbert Kornfeldt memorized his speech <fex>in the mailroom</fex>.
